original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras dag /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras dag /
translated: “O jinaputras!

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa la gnas pa ni 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad la mi rtag par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa la gnas pa ni 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad la mi rtag par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rtog go /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the third bodhisattva bhūmi correctly realizes that all formations are impermanent.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / rnam par 'jigs pa dang / ring du mi gnas pa dang / skad cig tu 'byung zhing 'gag pa dang / mi zad cing mi skye mi 'gag pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / rnam par 'jigs pa dang / ring du mi gnas pa dang / skad cig tu 'byung zhing 'gag pa dang / mi zad cing mi skye mi 'gag pa dang /
translated: He fully understands that it is suffering, devoid of self, unattractive, unreliable, terrifying, impermanent, and momentary, arising and ceasing.

original: sngon gyi mtha' kun nas ma byung ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha' 'pho ba med pa dang / da ltar byung ba mi gnas par rab tu rtog go /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' kun nas ma byung ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha' 'pho ba med pa dang / da ltar byung ba mi gnas par rab tu rtog go /
translated: He fully understands that it is inexhaustible, unborn, unceasing, not arisen in the past, not transferred to the future, and not abiding in the present.

original: 'du byed kyi rnam pa de lta bu la rab tu rtog pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rnam pa de lta bu la rab tu rtog pa'i tshe /
translated: When he fully understands such aspects of conditioned phenomena,

original: mngon par 'jig pa dang / mya ngan can /🔽smre sngags 'don pa can /
analyzed: mngon par 'jig pa dang / mya ngan can / smre sngags 'don pa can /
translated: he fully understands that they are subject to destruction,🔽are full of sorrow,🔽are full of lamentation,

original: 'khrug pa can /
analyzed: 'khrug pa can /
translated: are full of turmoil,

original: yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong bas rnam par bcings pa /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong bas rnam par bcings pa /
translated: are bound by what is attractive and unattractive,

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mang ba /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mang ba /
translated: are full of suffering and mental unease,

original: bsags pa med pa las byung ba /
analyzed: bsags pa med pa las byung ba /
translated: and are not accumulated.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me rab tu 'bar ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me rab tu 'bar ba /
translated: He fully understands that they are the blazing fire of desire, anger, and ignorance,🔽and that they are the great mass of suffering.

original: nad du mas rnam par skyed pa /
analyzed: nad du mas rnam par skyed pa /
translated: He sees them as being produced by many illnesses,

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin lta bur mthong nas /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin lta bur mthong nas /
translated: and as being like the nature of an illusion.

original: de de bas kyang 'du byed thams cad las sems gyen du skyod cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rab tu gtong ste /
analyzed: de de bas kyang 'du byed thams cad las sems gyen du skyod cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rab tu gtong ste /
translated: He then turns his mind away from all conditioned things and directs it toward the wisdom of the Tathāgata.

original: des de bzhin @110b gshegs pa'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'ang rjes su mthong ste /
analyzed: des de bzhin @110b gshegs pa'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'ang rjes su mthong ste /
translated: He sees that the wisdom of the Tathāgata is inconceivable.

original: mtshungs pa med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / rnyed par dka' ba dang / ma 'dres pa dang / gnod pa med pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i grong rdal du 'gro ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang /
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / rnyed par dka' ba dang / ma 'dres pa dang / gnod pa med pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i grong rdal du 'gro ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang /
translated: He sees that it is incomparable, immeasurable, difficult to attain, unique, harmless, undisturbed, leading to the city of fearlessness, irreversible,

original: 'gro ba mang po yongs su skyob pa yang yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'gro ba mang po yongs su skyob pa yang yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: and a refuge for many beings.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ltar tshad med pa mthong ste /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ltar tshad med pa mthong ste /
translated: He sees that the wisdom of the Tathāgata is immeasurable in this way.

original: 'du byed kyi rnam pa de ltar sdug bsngal mang pos gtses par mthong nas /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rnam pa de ltar sdug bsngal mang pos gtses par mthong nas /
translated: He sees that conditioned things are afflicted by many sufferings.

original: sems can thams cad la de bas kyang shas cher sems kyi bsam pa bcu nye bar gzhog ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la de bas kyang shas cher sems kyi bsam pa bcu nye bar gzhog ste /
translated: He also generates ten thoughts of great compassion for all sentient beings.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / rten med pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / rtag tu phongs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me kun nas 'bar ba'i sems kyi bsam pa dang /
analyzed: mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / rten med pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / rtag tu phongs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me kun nas 'bar ba'i sems kyi bsam pa dang /
translated: the thought that they are without a protector, without a refuge, and without a support; the thought that they are always poor; the thought that the fire of desire, anger, and ignorance is burning within them;

original: srid pa'i btson ras bzung ba'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par nyon mongs pa'i thibs pos bsgribs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / brtag pa'i mthu med pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / dge ba'i chos la mos pa med pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang /
analyzed: srid pa'i btson ras bzung ba'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par nyon mongs pa'i thibs pos bsgribs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / brtag pa'i mthu med pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / dge ba'i chos la mos pa med pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang /
translated: the thought that they are imprisoned in existence; the thought that they are always obscured by the thickets of the afflictions; the thought that they are without the power of analysis; the thought that they are without interest in virtuous qualities;

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las shin tu gol ba'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / 'khor ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'bab pa'i sems @111a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las shin tu gol ba'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / 'khor ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'bab pa'i sems @111a *//
translated: the thought that they are far from all the qualities of a buddha; the thought that they are carried away by the current of saṃsāra;🔽and the thought that they are without the power of liberation.

original: kyi bsam pa dang / thar pa'i lam gyis dngangs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / sems kyi bsam pa 'di bcu nye bar gzhog go /
analyzed: kyi bsam pa dang / thar pa'i lam gyis dngangs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa dang / sems kyi bsam pa 'di bcu nye bar gzhog go /
translated: They are: the thought of the mind that is to be liberated, the thought of the mind that is to be freed from the prison, the thought of the mind that is to be brought out of danger, the thought of the mind that is to be brought out of the wilderness, the thought of the mind that is to be brought out of the great water, the thought of the mind that is to be brought out of the great marsh, the thought of the mind that is to be brought out of the great city, the thought of the mind that is to be brought out of the great house, the thought of the mind that is to be brought out of the great prison, and the thought of the mind that is to be brought out of fear of the path to liberation.

original: des de ltar sems can gyi khams gtse ba mang po can mthong nas brtson 'grus 'di ltar rtsom ste /
analyzed: des de ltar sems can gyi khams gtse ba mang po can mthong nas brtson 'grus 'di ltar rtsom ste /
translated: “Having seen the realm of sentient beings with so many afflictions, he undertakes perseverance in the following way:

original: sems can 'di dag ni bdag gis bskyab par bya ba /🔽yongs su dgrol bar bya ba /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni bdag gis bskyab par bya ba / yongs su dgrol bar bya ba /
translated: ‘These sentient beings are to be protected by me.🔽They are to be freed.🔽They are to be purified.

original: yongs su sbyang bar bya ba /🔽shin tu gdon par bya ba /🔽rab tu dgod par bya ba /🔽shin tu brtan par bya ba /
analyzed: yongs su sbyang bar bya ba / shin tu gdon par bya ba / rab tu dgod par bya ba / shin tu brtan par bya ba /
translated: They are to be rescued.🔽They are to be established.🔽They are to be made firm.

original: yongs su tshim par bya ba /🔽gnas su phyin par bya ba /
analyzed: yongs su tshim par bya ba / gnas su phyin par bya ba /
translated: They are to be satisfied.🔽They are to be brought to the place.

original: rnam par gdul bar bya ba /
analyzed: rnam par gdul bar bya ba /
translated: They are to be disciplined.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba yin no //
translated: They are to be brought to complete nirvāṇa.’

original: zhes nas de de ltar 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad las skyo ba'i rjes su song zhing sems can thams cad la rab tu lta ba'i rjes su song ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su song zhing /
analyzed: zhes nas de de ltar 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad las skyo ba'i rjes su song zhing sems can thams cad la rab tu lta ba'i rjes su song ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su song zhing /
translated: “In this way, he becomes disenchanted with all conditioned things and looks after all beings. He follows omniscient wisdom and relies on the wisdom of the thus-gone ones.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rab tu brten pas sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba la brtson pa de 'di ltar yongs su rtog ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rab tu brten pas sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba la brtson pa de 'di ltar yongs su rtog ste /
translated: In order to protect all beings, he thinks,

original: rgyu dang / gzhi dang / tshul dang / thabs gang zhig gi 'di lta bur sdug bsngal dang; nye ba'i nyon mongs par lhung ba'i sems can 'di dag mngon par gdon par nus /
analyzed: rgyu dang / gzhi dang / tshul dang / thabs gang zhig gi 'di lta bur sdug bsngal dang; nye ba'i nyon mongs par lhung ba'i sems can 'di dag mngon par gdon par nus /
translated: ‘What are the causes, bases, methods, and means by which I can liberate these beings who have fallen into suffering and secondary afflictions?

original: rgyu dang / gzhi dang / tshul dang / thabs gang zhig gis ni shin tu bde ba'i mya ngan @111b las 'das par dgod par nus snyam nas /
analyzed: rgyu dang / gzhi dang / tshul dang / thabs gang zhig gis ni shin tu bde ba'i mya ngan @111b las 'das par dgod par nus snyam nas /
translated: What are the causes, bases, methods, and means by which I can establish them in the bliss of nirvāṇa?’

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes rnam par thar pa'i gnas ma gtogs par gzhan gyis mi nus so //
analyzed: bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes rnam par thar pa'i gnas ma gtogs par gzhan gyis mi nus so //
translated: “No one can do this except by means of the liberation that is unobstructed knowledge.

original: bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes rnam par thar pa'i gnas de yang chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ma gtogs par gzhan gyis thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes rnam par thar pa'i gnas de yang chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ma gtogs par gzhan gyis thob par mi nus so //
translated: And that liberation that is unobstructed knowledge cannot be attained except by understanding all things as they really are.

original: chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa yang rgyu ba med cing skye ba med pa la spyod pa'i shes rab ma gtogs par gzhan gyis khong du chud par mi nus so //
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa yang rgyu ba med cing skye ba med pa la spyod pa'i shes rab ma gtogs par gzhan gyis khong du chud par mi nus so //
translated: And that understanding of all things as they really are cannot be attained except by the wisdom that is practiced without movement or origination.

original: shes rab kyi snang ba de yang bsam gtan la mkhas shing rtogs pa'i blos rab tu rtog pa med par gzhan gyis thob par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi snang ba de yang bsam gtan la mkhas shing rtogs pa'i blos rab tu rtog pa med par gzhan gyis thob par mi rung ngo //
translated: And that illumination of wisdom cannot be attained except by the mind that is skilled in and has attained concentration.”

original: bsam gtan la mkhas shing rtog pa'i blos rab tu rtog pa de yang thos pas mkhas pa med par mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan la mkhas shing rtog pa'i blos rab tu rtog pa de yang thos pas mkhas pa med par mi 'byung ngo //
translated: And that skill in concentration and discernment through the mind of imagination does not occur without the skill of listening.

original: zhes de de ltar shin tu brtag pa'i shes pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: zhes de de ltar shin tu brtag pa'i shes pa dang ldan pas /
translated: Thus, with a knowledge that is very much like that,

original: de bas kyang shes cher dam pa'i chos tshol ba la mngon par brtson par gnas te /
analyzed: de bas kyang shes cher dam pa'i chos tshol ba la mngon par brtson par gnas te /
translated: he is even more intent on seeking the holy Dharma.

original: nyin mtshan du chos mnyan pa don du gnyer ba yin /
analyzed: nyin mtshan du chos mnyan pa don du gnyer ba yin /
translated: He is intent on listening to the Dharma day and night.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos btsal ba'i don du chos la mos shing ngoms mi shes la rgyun mi 'chad pa yin /🔽chos la dga' zhing spro ba dang chos la rab tu 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos btsal ba'i don du chos la mos shing ngoms mi shes la rgyun mi 'chad pa yin / chos la dga' zhing spro ba dang chos la rab tu 'jug pa yin /
translated: He is insatiable and uninterrupted in his interest in the Dharma for the sake of seeking the Buddha Dharma.🔽He delights in the Dharma and is happy with the Dharma. He is engaged in the Dharma.

original: chos la gzhol zhing chos la 'bab pa dang / chos la bab pa yin /🔽chos la rten cing chos la @112a *//
analyzed: chos la gzhol zhing chos la 'bab pa dang / chos la bab pa yin / chos la rten cing chos la @112a *//
translated: He is devoted to the Dharma, intent on the Dharma, and focused on the Dharma.

original: skyabs tshol ba dang / chos la mthu tshol ba yin /
analyzed: skyabs tshol ba dang / chos la mthu tshol ba yin /
translated: He relies on the Dharma and seeks refuge in the Dharma. He seeks strength in the Dharma.

original: chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la mngon par brtson pa yin te /
analyzed: chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la mngon par brtson pa yin te /
translated: He is intent on the Dharma and on the Dharma that is to be sought.

original: de de ltar chos tshol ba la mngon par brtson pas rin po che'i rnam pa'am /🔽dbyig gi rnam pa'am /
analyzed: de de ltar chos tshol ba la mngon par brtson pas rin po che'i rnam pa'am / dbyig gi rnam pa'am /
translated: In this way, he is so intent on seeking the Dharma that there is nothing he would not give up, whether it be his jewels,🔽his wealth,🔽his treasuries and storehouses,

original: nor dang 'bru'i mdzod dang / bang ba gang yang rung ste /🔽yongs su mi gtong ba de lta bu gang yang med do //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru'i mdzod dang / bang ba gang yang rung ste / yongs su mi gtong ba de lta bu gang yang med do //
translated: or anything else.

original: chos smra ba'i gang zag de 'ba' zhig la dka' ba'i 'du shes su gyur pa las phar /
analyzed: chos smra ba'i gang zag de 'ba' zhig la dka' ba'i 'du shes su gyur pa las phar /
translated: He has no sense of difficulty in regard to the person who teaches the Dharma,

original: de dag gzhan la cung zad kyang dga' ba'i 'du shes mi skyed do //🔽de ni chos kyi don du phyi rol gyi dngos po nye bar bzung ba yongs su mi gtong ba de gang yang med do //
analyzed: de dag gzhan la cung zad kyang dga' ba'i 'du shes mi skyed do // de ni chos kyi don du phyi rol gyi dngos po nye bar bzung ba yongs su mi gtong ba de gang yang med do //
translated: and he does not develop any sense of difficulty in regard to anything else.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.

original: nang gi dngos po yongs su mi gtong bar bya ba de lta bu'ang cung zad kyang med do //🔽gang 'di dag 'di lta ste /🔽g-yog 'khor yongs su gtang ba'am /🔽rgyal srid yongs su gtang ba'am /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po yongs su mi gtong bar bya ba de lta bu'ang cung zad kyang med do // gang 'di dag 'di lta ste / g-yog 'khor yongs su gtang ba'am / rgyal srid yongs su gtang ba'am /
translated: There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.🔽There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of the Dharma, whether it be external things or his very own flesh.

original: longs spyod yongs su gtang ba'am /
analyzed: longs spyod yongs su gtang ba'am /
translated: There is nothing that he would not give up for the sake of

original: nor dang / 'bru dang / nor bu dang / gser gyi mdzod dang / bang ba yongs su gtang ba dang / rta dang / glang po dang / shing rta dang / bzhon pa yongs su gtang ba'am /
analyzed: nor dang / 'bru dang / nor bu dang / gser gyi mdzod dang / bang ba yongs su gtang ba dang / rta dang / glang po dang / shing rta dang / bzhon pa yongs su gtang ba'am /
translated: He gives away his horses, elephants, chariots, and vehicles.

original: rin po che'i rgyan dang / lhab lhub yongs su gtang ba dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / bu mo yongs su gtang ba'am /
analyzed: rin po che'i rgyan dang / lhab lhub yongs su gtang ba dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / bu mo yongs su gtang ba'am /
translated: He gives away his precious ornaments and jewelry. He gives away his wife, sons, and daughters.

original: mgo dang / rkang lag dang / yan lag gi dam pa yongs su gtang ba'am /
analyzed: mgo dang / rkang lag dang / yan lag gi dam pa yongs su gtang ba'am /
translated: He gives away his head, hands, feet, and his most precious limbs.

original: lus thams cad @112b yongs su gtang bar bya ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: lus thams cad @112b yongs su gtang bar bya ba yang rung ste /
translated: He gives away his entire body.

original: de dag thams cad chos kyi don du yongs su mi gtong ba gang yang med do //🔽bla ma la bsnyen bkur dang / rim gror bya ba gang yang rung ste nyams su mi len pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: de dag thams cad chos kyi don du yongs su mi gtong ba gang yang med do // bla ma la bsnyen bkur dang / rim gror bya ba gang yang rung ste nyams su mi len pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that he will not give away for the sake of the Dharma.🔽There is nothing that he will not do to serve and honor his gurus.

original: nga rgyal dang lhag pa'i nga rgyal yongs su gtang bas nga rgyal med pa la sbyang ba gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang lhag pa'i nga rgyal yongs su gtang bas nga rgyal med pa la sbyang ba gang yang rung ste /
translated: He gives away his pride and conceit. There is nothing that he will not do to train in humility.

original: nyams su mi len pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: nyams su mi len pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that he will not practice.

original: lus kyi gnod pa gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: lus kyi gnod pa gang yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever physical harm there is,

original: nyams su mi len pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: nyams su mi len pa gang yang med do //
translated: there is nothing that he will not practice.

original: de ma thos pa'i chos kyi tshig gcig thos pa nor che bar 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: de ma thos pa'i chos kyi tshig gcig thos pa nor che bar 'dzin gyi /
translated: He considers the hearing of a single word of the Dharma that he has not heard to be a great gain,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su gang ba'i rin po che'i phung po thob pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su gang ba'i rin po che'i phung po thob pas ni ma yin no //
translated: not the acquisition of a mass of jewels filling the great billion-fold world system.

original: legs par bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig thos pas sems dga' bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: legs par bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig thos pas sems dga' bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: He is delighted by hearing a single verse of good advice,

original: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i srid la bskal pa brgya stong mang po'i mthar thug par gnas pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i srid la bskal pa brgya stong mang po'i mthar thug par gnas pas ni ma yin no //
translated: not by remaining for many hundreds of thousands of eons as Śakra, Brahmā, or a universal monarch.

original: de la la la zhig brgya la 'di skad du zer te /
analyzed: de la la la zhig brgya la 'di skad du zer te /
translated: If someone were to say to him,

original: gal te khyod kyis me'i dong chen por lus por te /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis me'i dong chen por lus por te /
translated: ‘If you throw yourself into a great pit of fire,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i phung po chen po rang gi lus kyis nyams su blang bar nus na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i phung po chen po rang gi lus kyis nyams su blang bar nus na /
translated: If you are able to experience with your body the great mass of painful feelings,

original: ngas khyod la chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa /
analyzed: ngas khyod la chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa /
translated: I will explain to you the words of the Dharma taught by the Perfectly Awakened One,🔽this instruction on the bodhisattva’s conduct.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su spyad pa 'di bshad par bya'o //🔽zhes na yang de 'di @113a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su spyad pa 'di bshad par bya'o // zhes na yang de 'di @113a *//
translated: I will explain this practice of the bodhisattva conduct.”🔽“Very well, Bhagavat,”🔽

original: snyam du sems te /
analyzed: snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks,🔽‘For the sake of the words of the Dharma taught by the Perfectly Awakened One, and for the sake of training in the bodhisattva’s conduct,

original: chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba'i don du ni; stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes gang bar yang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag gis bdag dor bar mos
analyzed: chos kyi tshig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba'i don du ni; stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes gang bar yang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag gis bdag dor bar mos
translated: I would throw myself from the Brahma world into a great billionfold world system filled with fire,

original: na / me'i dong tha mal pa 'di lta bu zhig tu bdag dor ba lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: na / me'i dong tha mal pa 'di lta bu zhig tu bdag dor ba lta ci smos kyi /
translated: let alone into an ordinary pit of fire.’

original: de bas sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su bab pas kyang bdag gis chos btsal bar bya'i /
analyzed: de bas sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su bab pas kyang bdag gis chos btsal bar bya'i /
translated: Therefore, even if all the sufferings of the hells were to descend upon me, I would seek the Dharma.

original: me'i sdug bsngal dang 'grogs pa lta khyad du gsad do //
analyzed: me'i sdug bsngal dang 'grogs pa lta khyad du gsad do //
translated: I would not give up on the suffering of fire.

original: zhes nas de rnam pa de lta bu'i brtson 'grus rtsom pas chos yongs su tshol lo //
analyzed: zhes nas de rnam pa de lta bu'i brtson 'grus rtsom pas chos yongs su tshol lo //
translated: Thus, he seeks the Dharma with this kind of effort.

original: ji skad du thos pa'i chos rnams la yang tshul bzhin du rab tu rtog pa'i ngang tshul can yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du thos pa'i chos rnams la yang tshul bzhin du rab tu rtog pa'i ngang tshul can yin te /
translated: He is also someone who properly reflects on the Dharma that he has heard.

original: de chos de dag thos nas kyang /
analyzed: de chos de dag thos nas kyang /
translated: Having heard the Dharma,🔽he then settles his mind in its natural state.

original: rjes la rang gi sems rtog par bzhag pas gcig pu dben pa na 'dug cing 'di ltar rtog go /
analyzed: rjes la rang gi sems rtog par bzhag pas gcig pu dben pa na 'dug cing 'di ltar rtog go /
translated: He is alone in an isolated place and reflects in this way:

original: chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du bya bas sangs rgyas kyi chos khong du chud par bya ba'i tshig gi lam yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig gis ma yin no //
analyzed: chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du bya bas sangs rgyas kyi chos khong du chud par bya ba'i tshig gi lam yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig gis ma yin no //
translated: “I will understand the Dharma of the Buddha through the practice of the Dharma and the application of the Dharma, not just through the pure path of the words.”

original: zhes te / byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa la gnas shing 'dod pa rnams las dben /
analyzed: zhes te / byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa la gnas shing 'dod pa rnams las dben /
translated: is separated from desire,

original: sdig to dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben zhing rnam par rtog pa @113b can; rnam par dpyod pa can /
analyzed: sdig to dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben zhing rnam par rtog pa @113b can; rnam par dpyod pa can /
translated: separated from evil and nonvirtuous dharmas, and endowed with investigation, endowed with analysis,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba'i bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba'i bsam gtan dang po la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: and he achieves and remains in the first concentration that is accompanied by investigation and analysis and is born from separation, and is endowed with joy and pleasure.

original: de rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa rnam par zhi ste /
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa rnam par zhi ste /
translated: Then, with the calming of investigation and analysis,

original: nang shin tu dang zhing sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas /🔽rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa med pa /
analyzed: nang shin tu dang zhing sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas / rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa med pa /
translated: he internally becomes totally clear and his mind becomes one-pointed,🔽and he achieves and remains in the second concentration that is without investigation and analysis,

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: is born of concentration, and is endowed with joy and pleasure.

original: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral te btang snyoms su gnas pas dran pa dang ldan zhing rab tu shes par bde ba yang lus kyis rab tu tshor te /
analyzed: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral te btang snyoms su gnas pas dran pa dang ldan zhing rab tu shes par bde ba yang lus kyis rab tu tshor te /
translated: He is free from attachment to joy and abides in equanimity, mindful and discerning.🔽He experiences with his body the bliss of which the noble ones say: ‘Equanimous and mindful one abides in bliss.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis btang snyoms pa dran pa can dga' ba med la bde ba la gnas pa'o zhes bya bar bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis btang snyoms pa dran pa can dga' ba med la bde ba la gnas pa'o zhes bya bar bsam gtan gsum pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: ’ Thus he achieves and abides in the third meditative concentration.

original: de bde ba yang spangs /🔽sdug bsngal yang spangs la bde ba'i yid dang / nyam nga ba'i yid kyang sngar nub pas sdug bsngal yang med /
analyzed: de bde ba yang spangs / sdug bsngal yang spangs la bde ba'i yid dang / nyam nga ba'i yid kyang sngar nub pas sdug bsngal yang med /
translated: He gives up pleasure.

original: bde ba yang med pa'i btang snyoms dran pas yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: bde ba yang med pa'i btang snyoms dran pas yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He gives up pain. With the disappearance of mental well-being and unease, he abides in the fourth meditative concentration, which is neither painful nor pleasant and includes the purification of mindfulness by equanimity.

original: de gzugs su 'du shes pa las rnam pa thams cad du 'das nas /
analyzed: de gzugs su 'du shes pa las rnam pa thams cad du 'das nas /
translated: He completely transcends perceptions of form.

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnam pa nub ste /
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnam pa nub ste /
translated: Perceptions of obstruction disappear.

original: 'du shes sna tshogs yid la mi byed pas mtha' yas nam mkha' zhes te /
analyzed: 'du shes sna tshogs yid la mi byed pas mtha' yas nam mkha' zhes te /
translated: Not attending to perceptions of multiplicity, he attends to infinite space.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs @114a *//
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs @114a *//
translated: It is the basis for the sphere of infinite space.🔽

original: te gnas so //
analyzed: te gnas so //
translated: He then enters and remains in the sphere of infinite space.

original: de nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i skye mched las rnam pa thams cad du 'das nas mtha' yas rnam shes zhes te /
analyzed: de nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i skye mched las rnam pa thams cad du 'das nas mtha' yas rnam shes zhes te /
translated: He then transcends the sphere of infinite space in its entirety and thinks, ‘Infinite consciousness.’

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He then enters and remains in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: de rnam par shes pa'i skye mched las rnam pa thams cad du 'das nas ma yod cung zad ces te /
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa'i skye mched las rnam pa thams cad du 'das nas ma yod cung zad ces te /
translated: He then transcends the sphere of infinite consciousness in its entirety and thinks, ‘There is nothing whatsoever.’

original: cung zad kyang med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: cung zad kyang med pa'i skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He then enters and remains in the sphere of nothing whatsoever.

original: de cung zad kyang med pa'i skye mched las rnam pa thams cad du 'das nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: de cung zad kyang med pa'i skye mched las rnam pa thams cad du 'das nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: He then transcends the sphere of nothing whatsoever in its entirety and enters and remains in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du byas pa ma gtogs par de yang mngon par dga' ba'i gnas dang rten ma yin pas /
analyzed: de chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la nan tan du byas pa ma gtogs par de yang mngon par dga' ba'i gnas dang rten ma yin pas /
translated: However, since this is not a basis for delight and support, he practices the Dharma and pursues the Dharma.

original: de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems yangs pa /
analyzed: de byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems yangs pa /
translated: He dwells having filled and pervaded with a mind endowed with love,🔽vast,

original: rgya che ba /
analyzed: rgya che ba /
translated: great,

original: gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa /
translated: non-dual,

original: tshad med pa /🔽kho na med pa /
analyzed: tshad med pa / kho na med pa /
translated: immeasurable,🔽without hostility,

original: ltod pa med pa /
analyzed: ltod pa med pa /
translated: without enmity,

original: bsgribs pa med pa /🔽gnod pa med pa thams cad du khyab pas 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
analyzed: bsgribs pa med pa / gnod pa med pa thams cad du khyab pas 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
translated: without obstruction,

original: nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad rgyas par bkang nas nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad rgyas par bkang nas nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: without affliction, the world systems of the ten directions, as far as the ends of space, the extent of the realm of phenomena.🔽Similarly, he dwells having filled and pervaded with a mind endowed with compassion,

original: de bzhin du snying rje dang ldan pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems yangs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du snying rje dang ldan pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i sems yangs pa /
translated: with joy,🔽with equanimity,🔽vast,

original: rgya che ba /
analyzed: rgya che ba /
translated: great,

original: gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa /
translated: non-dual,

original: tshad med pa /🔽khon med pa /🔽ltod pa med pa /🔽bsgribs pa @114b med pa /
analyzed: tshad med pa / khon med pa / ltod pa med pa / bsgribs pa @114b med pa /
translated: immeasurable,🔽without hostility,🔽without enmity,

original: gnod pa med pa /🔽thams cad du khyab pas 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa / thams cad du khyab pas 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
translated: without obstruction,

original: nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad rgyas par bkang nas nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad rgyas par bkang nas nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: without affliction, the world systems of the ten directions, as far as the ends of space, the extent of the realm of phenomena.

original: de rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa du ma myong bar byed de /
analyzed: de rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa du ma myong bar byed de /
translated: He experiences many kinds of magical transformations.

original: sa 'di yang g-yo bar byed do //🔽gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa 'di yang g-yo bar byed do // gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: He shakes this earth.🔽He becomes one and then many.

original: mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes many and then one.

original: snang ba dang mi snang ba la'ang rab tu spyod de /🔽rtsig pa la thags thogs med pa dang / ra ba la thags thogs pa med pa dang / ri la yang /
analyzed: snang ba dang mi snang ba la'ang rab tu spyod de / rtsig pa la thags thogs med pa dang / ra ba la thags thogs pa med pa dang / ri la yang /
translated: He appears and disappears.

original: dper na / nam mkha' bzhin du thags thogs med cing chags pa med par 'gro'o //🔽dper na / nam mkha' la lding ba'i bya bzhin du nam mkha' la'ang skyil mo krung gis gnas par byed do //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' bzhin du thags thogs med cing chags pa med par 'gro'o // dper na / nam mkha' la lding ba'i bya bzhin du nam mkha' la'ang skyil mo krung gis gnas par byed do //
translated: He goes through walls, through enclosures, through mountains without being obstructed as if through space.

original: chu bzhin du sa la yang nub cing 'byung bar ston to //
analyzed: chu bzhin du sa la yang nub cing 'byung bar ston to //
translated: He dives into the earth as if into water.

original: sa bzhin du chu la yang 'byin pa med par 'gro'o //🔽me'i phung po chen po bzhin du du ba 'thul lo //
analyzed: sa bzhin du chu la yang 'byin pa med par 'gro'o // me'i phung po chen po bzhin du du ba 'thul lo //
translated: He walks on water without sinking as if on earth.🔽He sits cross-legged through space and flies like a bird.

original: me lce 'bar ro //🔽sprin chen po bzhin du lus las char 'bebs so //
analyzed: me lce 'bar ro //🔽sprin chen po bzhin du lus las char 'bebs so //
translated: He emits smoke and fire from his body like a great bonfire.🔽He touches and strokes with his hand the moon and sun, so mighty and powerful, and he wields his body even as far as the Brahma world.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che zhing 'di ltar mthu che la /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che zhing 'di ltar mthu che la /
translated: The sun and moon are so powerful and majestic,🔽

original: 'di ltar dbang che bar grags pa dag kyang lag pas nyug cing reg par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang che bar grags pa dag kyang lag pas nyug cing reg par byed do //
translated: He can touch and stroke the sun and moon, which are so powerful and majestic,

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du yang lus kyis dbang bsgyur te /🔽de lha'i rna ba'i khams rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas lha dang mi'i sgra gnyis ka yang nyan to //🔽ring yang rung /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du yang lus kyis dbang bsgyur te / de lha'i rna ba'i khams rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas lha dang mi'i sgra gnyis ka yang nyan to // ring yang rung /
translated: and he can even go as far as the Brahma world.

original: @115a *// nye yang rung ste /
analyzed: @115a *// nye yang rung ste /
translated: With his divine ear, which is pure and surpasses human hearing, he can hear both far and near,

original: chung ngu na sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / bung ba dang / srin bu'i sgra yang thos so //
analyzed: chung ngu na sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / bung ba dang / srin bu'i sgra yang thos so //
translated: even the sounds of insects, bees, and mosquitoes.

original: de sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems kyang sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems kyang sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: He can know the minds of other beings and other individuals, just as they are.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: He can know a mind with passion as a mind with passion,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is that a mind free from desire is free from desire.

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs dang bral ba dang / che ba dang; chung ba dang /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs dang bral ba dang / che ba dang; chung ba dang /
translated: He knows as it really is that a mind with hatred is with hatred, a mind free from hatred is free from hatred, a mind with ignorance is with ignorance, a mind free from ignorance is free from ignorance, a mind with afflictions is with afflictions, a mind without afflictions is without afflictions, a great mind is great, a small mind is small,

original: yangs pa dang / dog pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par ma grol ba dang / skyon can dang / skyon med pa dang / sems rgya chen po la sems rgya chen po'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: yangs pa dang / dog pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par ma grol ba dang / skyon can dang / skyon med pa dang / sems rgya chen po la sems rgya chen po'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: a vast mind is vast, a narrow mind is narrow, a concentrated mind is concentrated, an unconcentrated mind is unconcentrated, a liberated mind is liberated, an unliberated mind is unliberated, a mind with faults is with faults, a mind without faults is without faults, and a vast mind is vast.

original: sems rgya chung ngu la sems rgya chung ngu'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sems rgya chung ngu la sems rgya chung ngu'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows as it really is that a small mind is small.

original: de ltar na sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ltar na sems can pha rol dang / gang zag pha rol gyi sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: In this way, he knows the minds of other beings and other persons as they really are.

original: de rnam pa @115b du mar sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran te /
analyzed: de rnam pa @115b du mar sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran te /
translated: He recollects his many previous abodes,

original: tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: tshe rabs gcig kyang rjes su dran no //
translated: recollecting one birth,

original: gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang / tshe rabs brgya yang rjes su dran no //🔽tshe rabs brgya phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs stong phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs brgya stong phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs bye ba brgya stong phrag du ma nas /
analyzed: gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang / tshe rabs brgya yang rjes su dran no // tshe rabs brgya phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs stong phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs brgya stong phrag du ma dang / tshe rabs bye ba brgya stong phrag du ma nas /
translated: two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred births,

original: tshe rabs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma'i bar du rjes su dran no //
analyzed: tshe rabs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma'i bar du rjes su dran no //
translated: many hundreds of births, many thousands of births, many hundreds of thousands of births, many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of births.🔽He recollects his many previous abodes, with their characteristics and details.

original: 'du ba'i bskal pa du ma dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma dang / 'du ba dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma yang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: 'du ba'i bskal pa du ma dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma dang / 'du ba dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma yang rjes su dran no //
translated: He recollects many eons of dissolution, many eons of evolution, many eons of dissolution and evolution.

original: bskal pa brgya yang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: bskal pa brgya yang rjes su dran no //
translated: He recollects a hundred eons.🔽He recollects a thousand eons, a hundred thousand eons, a million eons, a hundred million eons, a billion eons, a hundred billion eons, a quintillion eons, a hundred quintillion eons.

original: bskal pa stong dang / bskal pa stong phrag brgya dang / bskal pa bye ba stong phrag brgya nas bskal pa bye ba brgya stong du ma'i bar du rjes su dran no //🔽bskal pa khrag khrig dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya dang / bskal pa khrag khrig stong dang / bskal pa khrag khrig stong phrag brgya dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong nas /🔽bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i bar du rjes su dran te /🔽bdag ni che ge mo zhig na 'dug 'dug go /
analyzed: bskal pa stong dang / bskal pa stong phrag brgya dang / bskal pa bye ba stong phrag brgya nas bskal pa bye ba brgya stong du ma'i bar du rjes su dran no // bskal pa khrag khrig dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya dang / bskal pa khrag khrig stong dang / bskal pa khrag khrig stong phrag brgya dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong nas / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i bar du rjes su dran te / bdag ni che ge mo zhig na 'dug 'dug go /
translated: He recollects many quintillions of eons.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu las bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shas che @118b ba yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu las bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shas che @118b ba yin te /
translated: Among the ten perfections, the perfection of patience is predominant,

original: lhag ma rnams kyang ci tshul ci nus su yang dag par mi sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang ci tshul ci nus su yang dag par mi sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: but this is not to say that they practice the other perfections fully and perfectly.

original: kye / rgyal ba'i sras dag /
analyzed: kye / rgyal ba'i sras dag /
translated: “O jinaputras!

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the bodhisattva bhūmi Luminous,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third bodhisattva ground, The Luminous.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phal cher lha'i rgyal po'i dbang po 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phal cher lha'i rgyal po'i dbang po 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this ground mostly becomes a lord of the gods, a Śakra.

original: sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rnam par bzlog pa'i thabs nye bar bsgrubs pa la mkhas shing mthu yod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rnam par bzlog pa'i thabs nye bar bsgrubs pa la mkhas shing mthu yod pa yin /
translated: He is skilled and powerful in applying the means to turn beings away from attachment to sense objects.

original: de sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'am /
translated: Whatever roots of virtue he creates, whether through generosity,

original: ngag snyan pa'am /🔽don bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: ngag snyan pa'am / don bsgrub pa'am /
translated: kind words,🔽helpful activity,

original: don mthun pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang rung ste /
analyzed: don mthun pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang rung ste /
translated: or consistency between words and deeds,

original: de thams cad ji ltar na sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur /
analyzed: de thams cad ji ltar na sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur /
translated: he does so with the thought, “How can I become the best of all sentient beings,

original: gtso bor 'gyur /🔽thu bor 'gyur /🔽phul du 'gyur /
analyzed: gtso bor 'gyur / thu bor 'gyur / phul du 'gyur /
translated: the foremost,🔽the highest,🔽the most excellent,

original: dam par 'gyur /
analyzed: dam par 'gyur /
translated: the supreme,

original: bla na med par 'gyur /🔽'dren par 'gyur /
analyzed: bla na med par 'gyur / 'dren par 'gyur /
translated: the unsurpassed,🔽the leader,

original: rnam par 'dren par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par 'dren par 'gyur /
translated: the guide,

original: yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rten pa'i bar du 'gyur snyam ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dren par 'gyur ba nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rten pa'i bar du 'gyur snyam ste /
translated: and the one who brings everyone to the knowledge of a buddha?”

original: sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang / chos yid la bya ba dang / dge 'dun yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yid la bya ba dang; byang chub sems dpa'i sa yid la bya ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang / chos yid la bya ba dang / dge 'dun yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' yid la bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yid la bya ba dang; byang chub sems dpa'i sa yid la bya ba dang /
translated: They are never separate from keeping in mind the Buddha, keeping in mind the Dharma, keeping in mind the Saṅgha, keeping in mind the bodhisattvas, keeping in mind the bodhisattva conduct, keeping in mind the bodhisattva levels,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba dang / stobs yid la bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa yid la bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma @119a *//🔽'dres pa yid la bya ba nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bya ba dang / stobs yid la bya ba dang / mi 'jigs pa yid la bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma @119a *// 'dres pa yid la bya ba nas /
translated: keeping in mind the perfections, keeping in mind the powers, keeping in mind the fearlessnesses, keeping in mind the detailed and thorough knowledges, keeping in mind the buddhadharmas,

original: rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba yin te /
translated: up to keeping in mind the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.🔽“

original: de 'dod na skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu ting nge 'dzin brgya stong rab tu thob cing de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas brgya stong mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang /
analyzed: de 'dod na skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu ting nge 'dzin brgya stong rab tu thob cing de dag la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas brgya stong mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang /
translated: If they wish, in an instant, a brief moment, a short second, they can attain and rest in a hundred thousand meditative stabilities,🔽see a hundred thousand buddhas, understand those buddhas’ blessings,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya stong skyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya stong du 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya stong snang bar bya ba dang / sems can brgya stong yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bskal pa brgya stong du gnas par bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya stong skyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya stong du 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya stong snang bar bya ba dang / sems can brgya stong yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bskal pa brgya stong du gnas par bya ba dang /
translated: cause a hundred thousand worlds to shake, go to a hundred thousand buddhafields, illuminate a hundred thousand worlds, bring a hundred thousand sentient beings to full maturity, remain for a hundred thousand eons,

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa brgya stong la rab tu 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo brgya stong rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus brgya stong yongs su bstan pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor brgya stong yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa de lta bu rtsom mo //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa brgya stong la rab tu 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo brgya stong rnam par 'byed pa dang / lus brgya stong yongs su bstan pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor brgya stong yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa de lta bu rtsom mo //
translated: They are diligent in entering into hundreds of thousands of past and future eons, in opening hundreds of thousands of Dharma doors, in manifesting hundreds of thousands of bodies, and in manifesting on each body hundreds of thousands of bodhisattva retinues.

original: de yan chad byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi mthu can rnams smon lam gyi khyad par gyis rnam par 'phrul te /
analyzed: de yan chad byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi mthu can rnams smon lam gyi khyad par gyis rnam par 'phrul te /
translated: “Beyond that, bodhisattvas who have the power of aspiration manifest through the particularities of their aspirations.

original: de dag gi lus sam /
analyzed: de dag gi lus sam /
translated: Their bodies,🔽their light,

original: 'od dam / rdzu 'phrul lam /
analyzed: 'od dam / rdzu 'phrul lam /
translated: their miracles,🔽their eyes,

original: mig gam / spyod yul lam /
analyzed: mig gam / spyod yul lam /
translated: their range,🔽their voices,

original: dbyangs sam / spyod pa'am /
analyzed: dbyangs sam / spyod pa'am /
translated: their conduct,🔽their adornments,

original: rgyan @119b tam; byin gyi rlabs sam /
analyzed: rgyan @119b tam; byin gyi rlabs sam /
translated: and their blessings🔽are beyond measure.

original: mos pa'am / mngon par 'du byed pa dag kyang bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma'i bar gyis bgrang bar dka'o //
analyzed: mos pa'am / mngon par 'du byed pa dag kyang bskal pa du ma dang / bskal pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma'i bar gyis bgrang bar dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to count the number of eons that have passed since they first aroused the mind of awakening, whether it was many eons, many hundreds of eons, many thousands of eons, many hundreds of thousands of eons, or many quintillions of eons.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying pos don 'di nyid yang brtag pa dang bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying pos don 'di nyid yang brtag pa dang bstan par bya ba'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajra garbha, in order to explain this topic further, recited these verses:

original: de dag yon tan 'byung gnas bsam dag sems des pa //
analyzed: de dag yon tan 'byung gnas bsam dag sems des pa //
translated: “Those who are the source of good qualities, who have pure minds,

original: skyo zhing 'dod chags bral te 'tshe med sems dang ldan //
analyzed: skyo zhing 'dod chags bral te 'tshe med sems dang ldan //
translated: Who are free from weariness, desire, and harm,

original: sems bskyed bstan pa dga' ldan rgya chen shugs can rnams //
analyzed: sems bskyed bstan pa dga' ldan rgya chen shugs can rnams //
translated: Who have the power of the mind of awakening, who are joyful, and who have great strength,

original: mkhas pa bdag nyid che ba'i sems ldan gsum pa gnon //
analyzed: mkhas pa bdag nyid che ba'i sems ldan gsum pa gnon //
translated: And who have the mind of the great beings, the wise ones, attain the third bhūmi.

original: 'od byed sa phyogs 'di la gnas pa'i mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: 'od byed sa phyogs 'di la gnas pa'i mkhas pa ni //
translated: “The wise ones who are on this bhūmi, Luminous,

original: sdug bsngal mi rtag mi sdug rab tu 'jig chos dang // ring por mi gnas skad cig snying po med par ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi rtag mi sdug rab tu 'jig chos dang // ring por mi gnas skad cig snying po med par ni //
translated: That they do not last long, are momentary, and have no core.

original: 'dus byas rnam pa 'ong ba med la rab tu rtog /
analyzed: 'dus byas rnam pa 'ong ba med la rab tu rtog /
translated: They understand that conditioned things have no coming,

original: nad du gyur pa mya ngan smre sngags 'don dang bcas //
analyzed: nad du gyur pa mya ngan smre sngags 'don dang bcas //
translated: Are sick, sorrowful, and full of lamentations,

original: gnod dang 'khrug dang sdug dang mi sdug rjes 'brang ba //
analyzed: gnod dang 'khrug dang sdug dang mi sdug rjes 'brang ba //
translated: And are followed by what is unpleasant and what is not.🔽“They see that conditioned things are like a mass of flames,

original: sdug bsngal yid blong phung po 'bar ba'i me 'dra bar //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yid blong phung po 'bar ba'i me 'dra bar //
translated: A mass of suffering, a mass of distress, and a mass of misery.

original: 'dus byas mtha' yas kun nas 'bar mthong de las skyod //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtha' yas kun nas 'bar mthong de las skyod //
translated: They see that conditioned things are burning everywhere, and they leave.

original: srid pa gsum po kun las skyo zhing ltos sems med //
analyzed: srid pa gsum po kun las skyo zhing ltos sems med //
translated: “They are disenchanted with the three realms of existence and do not rely on them.

original: bde @120a *// gshegs ye shes 'dod cing blo gzhan med pa ste //
analyzed: bde @120a *// gshegs ye shes 'dod cing blo gzhan med pa ste //
translated: They desire the wisdom of the sugatas and have no other thought.🔽“They see the wisdom of the jinas, which is inconceivable,

original: bsam du med cing gzhal yas pha rol mtha' yas pa'i //🔽rgyal pa'i ye shes gnod med de dag rab tu mthong //
analyzed: bsam du med cing gzhal yas pha rol mtha' yas pa'i // rgyal pa'i ye shes gnod med de dag rab tu mthong //
translated: Incalculable, infinite, and without harm.

original: de dag sangs rgyas ye shes gnod med mthong gyur nas //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas ye shes gnod med mthong gyur nas //
translated: “Having seen the wisdom of the buddhas, which is without harm,

original: skyabs med mgon dang bral pa rab tu dgrol ba'i phyir //
analyzed: skyabs med mgon dang bral pa rab tu dgrol ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to liberate those who have no refuge and are without a protector,🔽“They make a vast, great, and extensive aspiration

original: rtag tu dbul zhing me gsum kun nas 'bar gyur dang // srid pa'i btson rar sdug bsngal sna brgyas sems bskor cing //
analyzed: rtag tu dbul zhing me gsum kun nas 'bar gyur dang // srid pa'i btson rar sdug bsngal sna brgyas sems bskor cing //
translated: And in the prison of existence, their minds are surrounded by a hundred sufferings.

original: nyon mongs bsgribs dang rnam par lta dang 'dod nyams pa //
analyzed: nyon mongs bsgribs dang rnam par lta dang 'dod nyams pa //
translated: Obscured by afflictions, with wrong views and degenerate morality,

original: bde gshegs chos kyi dga' ba stor ba'i byis pa rnams //
analyzed: bde gshegs chos kyi dga' ba stor ba'i byis pa rnams //
translated: Those childish beings have lost the bliss of the Dharma of the Sugatas.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyud du 'bab cing thar pas dngangs gyur pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyud du 'bab cing thar pas dngangs gyur pa //
translated: They fall into the stream of saṃsāra, terrified by liberation.🔽I will protect them!’ With this thought, they apply themselves with the highest diligence.

original: bdag gis bskyabs pa yin zhes brtson 'grus dam du rtsom; ;ye shes 'dod pas ltos pa med par 'gro don byed //
analyzed: bdag gis bskyabs pa yin zhes brtson 'grus dam du rtsom; ;ye shes 'dod pas ltos pa med par 'gro don byed //
translated: Desiring wisdom, they work for the welfare of beings without concern for themselves.

original: gang rgyus rnam thar lam gyi rgyud ni gang zhes rtog /
analyzed: gang rgyus rnam thar lam gyi rgyud ni gang zhes rtog /
translated: They investigate the causes of the stream of the path to liberation.

original: bde gshegs ye shes bsgribs pa med las gzhan med na //
analyzed: bde gshegs ye shes bsgribs pa med las gzhan med na //
translated: They know that it is not something other than the Sugata’s unobstructed wisdom.

original: bde gshegs ye shes de yang shes rab mthus 'byung ste //
analyzed: bde gshegs ye shes de yang shes rab mthus 'byung ste //
translated: And that Sugata wisdom arises through the power of wisdom.

original: shes rab thos las 'byung bar byang chub sems dpa' rtog /
analyzed: shes rab thos las 'byung bar byang chub sems dpa' rtog /
translated: The bodhisattvas know that wisdom comes from listening.

original: de ltar shes nas thos don spyad par brtson 'grus rtsom //
analyzed: de ltar shes nas thos don spyad par brtson 'grus rtsom //
translated: Knowing this, they apply themselves with diligence to practicing what they have heard.

original: nyin mtshan nyan pa'i rgyur spyod bya ba gzhan med par //
analyzed: nyin mtshan nyan pa'i rgyur spyod bya ba gzhan med par //
translated: Day and night, they practice listening to the Dharma, and nothing else.

original: chos kyi don gnyer chos la rab tu rten pa yin //
analyzed: chos kyi don gnyer chos la rab tu rten pa yin //
translated: They are devoted to the Dharma and strive for the meaning of the Dharma.🔽They give away their collections of jewels, pearls, and gems, their friends and relatives,

original: nor bu mu tig rin chen tshogs dang @120b mdza' gnyen dang // srid longs du ma pho brang phun ldan dam pa dang // chung ma dag dang bu dang mthun par spyod ba'i 'khor //
analyzed: nor bu mu tig rin chen tshogs dang @120b mdza' gnyen dang // srid longs du ma pho brang phun ldan dam pa dang // chung ma dag dang bu dang mthun par spyod ba'i 'khor //
translated: their many kingdoms, their perfect and excellent palaces, their wives and children, and their retinues of attendants,

original: ltos med sems kyis mkhas pa chos kyi don du gtong //🔽mgo dang rkang lag mig dang de bzhin bdag gi sha /
analyzed: ltos med sems kyis mkhas pa chos kyi don du gtong // mgo dang rkang lag mig dang de bzhin bdag gi sha /
translated: without any regard, with a mind that is skilled in the meaning of the Dharma.🔽They give away their heads, legs, arms, eyes, and likewise their flesh,🔽their tongues, teeth, ears, noses, blood,

original: lce dang mche ba rna ba sna dang khrag rnams dang // phangs pa'i rkang dang snying phyung yongs su gtong bar byed //
analyzed: lce dang mche ba rna ba sna dang khrag rnams dang // phangs pa'i rkang dang snying phyung yongs su gtong bar byed //
translated: and their cherished marrow and hearts.

original: 'di ni dka' bar mi rtsi thos pa de dkar rtsi //
analyzed: 'di ni dka' bar mi rtsi thos pa de dkar rtsi //
translated: They do not consider this difficult, but rather they consider listening to the Dharma to be difficult.

original: la la de drung 'ongs shing de skad smrar gyur te //
analyzed: la la de drung 'ongs shing de skad smrar gyur te //
translated: Someone might come before them and say,

original: de ste me lce mi bzad 'bar dong mchong phod na //
analyzed: de ste me lce mi bzad 'bar dong mchong phod na //
translated: ‘If you can jump into this pit of blazing flames,

original: bde gshegs bstan chos rin chen bshad do zhes na yang //
analyzed: bde gshegs bstan chos rin chen bshad do zhes na yang //
translated: I will explain the precious Dharma of the Sugata.’

original: thos nas mi dma'i yid kyis yon tan don du mchod //
analyzed: thos nas mi dma'i yid kyis yon tan don du mchod //
translated: Having heard it, with a humble mind, they make offerings for the sake of good qualities.

original: chos kyi tshig gcig don du ri rab brtses btags par //
analyzed: chos kyi tshig gcig don du ri rab brtses btags par //
translated: For the sake of a single word of Dharma, they would climb a mountain of swords.

original: stong gsum mes bkang tshangs ris yul nas mchongs gyur kyang //
analyzed: stong gsum mes bkang tshangs ris yul nas mchongs gyur kyang //
translated: Even if they were to jump from the realm of Brahmā into a trichiliocosm filled with fire,

original: da dung rgyal ba'i byang chub yangs pa thob dka' na //
analyzed: da dung rgyal ba'i byang chub yangs pa thob dka' na //
translated: if they still find it difficult to attain the vast enlightenment of the Victorious Ones,

original: de ste tha mal mi bdes rnyed 'gyur shin tu bde //
analyzed: de ste tha mal mi bdes rnyed 'gyur shin tu bde //
translated: how much more so if they seek it through ordinary human pleasures!

original: drang srong mchog gi ye shes 'thob 'gyur ji srid pa //
analyzed: drang srong mchog gi ye shes 'thob 'gyur ji srid pa //
translated: For as long as they have not attained the wisdom of the supreme sages,

original: de srid bar du mnar med sdug bsngal bzod bya na //
analyzed: de srid bar du mnar med sdug bsngal bzod bya na //
translated: for that long they will endure the suffering of the Avīci hell.

original: mi yi sdug bsngal phung po sna tshogs ci smos kyi //
analyzed: mi yi sdug bsngal phung po sna tshogs ci smos kyi //
translated: What need is there to mention the various sufferings of humans?

original: chos rab mnyam pa'i don du bdag gis nyams blang zhes //
analyzed: chos rab mnyam pa'i don du bdag gis nyams blang zhes //
translated: “I will practice in order to attain the equality of phenomena.”

original: chos rnams thos par gyur nas tshul bzhin sems par byed //
analyzed: chos rnams thos par gyur nas tshul bzhin sems par byed //
translated: Having heard the Dharma, they contemplate it properly.

original: bsam gtan tshad med de bzhin gzugs med rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: bsam gtan tshad med de bzhin gzugs med rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless states,

original: mngon par shes pa'i @121a *//🔽dam pa lnga po mngon sgrub kyang //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i @121a *//🔽dam pa lnga po mngon sgrub kyang //
translated: The five higher perceptions,

original: de dag dbang gis skye bar de dag 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: de dag dbang gis skye bar de dag 'gyur ba min //
translated: And through their power, they are not born in the lower realms.

original: legs ldan 'di gnas sangs rgyas khrag khrig mang po la //
analyzed: legs ldan 'di gnas sangs rgyas khrag khrig mang po la //
translated: They make offerings to many hundreds of thousands of buddhas

original: mchod par byed cing des rtogs yid kyis chos kyang nyan //🔽bsrabs par gyur cing log bral yongs su dag par 'gyur //
analyzed: mchod par byed cing des rtogs yid kyis chos kyang nyan // bsrabs par gyur cing log bral yongs su dag par 'gyur //
translated: And listen to the Dharma with a mind that understands it.🔽They become free of the obscurations of karma and affliction,

original: skyon med gser sbram ji ltar srang la gcal ba bzhin //
analyzed: skyon med gser sbram ji ltar srang la gcal ba bzhin //
translated: And like refined gold, they are completely purified.

original: de gnas yon tan ldan pa lha yi bdag po ste //
analyzed: de gnas yon tan ldan pa lha yi bdag po ste //
translated: They become the lords of gods, endowed with good qualities,

original: dbang sgyur don byed 'dod pa'i nad kyi rnam pa sel //
analyzed: dbang sgyur don byed 'dod pa'i nad kyi rnam pa sel //
translated: And they cure the various diseases of desire.

original: lha mang sna tshogs du ma dge ba'i lam la dgod //
analyzed: lha mang sna tshogs du ma dge ba'i lam la dgod //
translated: They establish many different gods on the path of virtue,

original: sangs rgyas yon tan mngon 'dod bsam pa gzhan yang med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas yon tan mngon 'dod bsam pa gzhan yang med //
translated: And they have no other wish than to attain the qualities of buddhahood.

original: 'di la gnas pa'i rgyal sras brtson 'grus rab rtsom ste //
analyzed: 'di la gnas pa'i rgyal sras brtson 'grus rab rtsom ste //
translated: The bodhisattvas who abide on this ground exert themselves in diligence

original: brgya phrag stong las mi nyung ting 'dzin thob pa yin //
analyzed: brgya phrag stong las mi nyung ting 'dzin thob pa yin //
translated: And attain hundreds of thousands of samādhis.

original: mtshan rab sku brgyan sangs rgyas rnams kyang rab tu mthong //
analyzed: mtshan rab sku brgyan sangs rgyas rnams kyang rab tu mthong //
translated: They see the buddhas, whose bodies are adorned with the major marks.

original: yan chad smon lam rab ldan yon tan bsam mi khyab //

analyzed: de lta de ltar 'jam pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin /

analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba skyed pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin /

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin /

analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin /

original: bla ma la @127a *//
analyzed: bla ma la @127a *//

analyzed: ji skad du thos pa'i chos la nan tan du byed pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin te /

analyzed: 'grogs na bde zhing des pa yin /

original: 'jam zhing mnyen pa yin /
analyzed: 'jam zhing mnyen pa yin /

analyzed: sgyu med cing nga rgyal med pa thibs po med par spyod pa yin /

analyzed: mthun par 'dzin cing nga lo bde ba yin te /

original: de de ltar bzod pa dang ldan /
analyzed: de de ltar bzod pa dang ldan /
translated: They are patient in this way.

original: de ltar dul ba dang ldan /
analyzed: de ltar dul ba dang ldan /

original: de ltar zhi ba dang ldan te /
analyzed: de ltar zhi ba dang ldan te /

analyzed: de ltar bzod cing dul ba zhi ba dang ldan pas /

original: mtha' yas pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin /

analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin /

analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin /

original: mi 'phrogs pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin /

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa @127b yin; tshul dang mi tshul ba bye brag phyed pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa @127b yin; tshul dang mi tshul ba bye brag phyed pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin te /

original: phyir zhing de'i bsam pa'i khams yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir zhing de'i bsam pa'i khams yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams dang rnam par mi 'bral lo //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams dang rnam par mi 'bral lo //
translated: He will not be separated from the element of superior intention.

original: mos pa'i khams kyang shin tu byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mos pa'i khams kyang shin tu byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: His element of devotion will be purified.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel ba dang yongs su skye'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel ba dang yongs su skye'o //
translated: His roots of virtue will increase and grow.

original: 'jig rten gyi dri ma'i rnyog pa dang yang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dri ma'i rnyog pa dang yang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be free from the turbidity of worldly defilements.

analyzed: the tshom dang / yid gnyis dang / nem nur yang rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: nem nur med pa la mngon sum du gyur pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //

original: dga' ba dang bag yangs kyang yang dag par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bag yangs kyang yang dag par 'byung ngo //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pa rlabs po che yang mngon sum du 'gyur ro //

original: sems kyi bsam pa tshad med pa yang yang dag par skye'o //
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa tshad med pa yang yang dag par skye'o //

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa ste /

analyzed: 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phal cher lha'i rgyal po rab mtshe mar 'gyur te /

original: sems can rnams kyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba mang po yang dag par gzhom @129b pa la mkhas shing mthu yod pa yin /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba mang po yang dag par gzhom @129b pa la mkhas shing mthu yod pa yin /

original: de sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'am /
translated: Whatever roots of virtue they create, whether through generosity,

original: ngag snyan pa'am /🔽don bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: ngag snyan pa'am / don bsgrub pa'am /
translated: pleasant words,🔽beneficial conduct,

original: don mthun pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang rung ste /
analyzed: don mthun pas dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci rtsom yang rung ste /

original: de thams cad ji ltar na /
analyzed: de thams cad ji ltar na /
